intro: Chassalia beamanii, commonly known as the Beaman's chassalia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool temperatures. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
